data.title: Overview of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter introduces the definition, history, basic theories, and research areas of criminal psychology.

items.title: Definition of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology is the study of criminal behavior and its psychological mechanisms, aiming to understand the psychological characteristics and behavioral motivations of criminals.

items.title: Development History of Criminal Psychology
items.text: Criminal psychology originated in the late 19th century and gradually formed an independent discipline with the development of psychology and law.

items.title: Main Research Areas
items.text: Including the causes of criminal psychology, analysis of crime types, assessment and intervention of criminal psychology, etc.

items.title: Relationship with Other Disciplines
items.text: Criminal psychology is closely related to disciplines such as law, sociology, and biology, jointly exploring criminal phenomena.

items.title: Biological Theories
items.text: Exploring the impact of genetic, neurophysiological, and other factors on criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Theories
items.text: Analyzing the correlation between personality, cognition, emotion, and criminal behavior.

items.title: Sociological Theories
items.text: Studying the shaping role of social environment and cultural background on criminal psychology.

items.title: Integrated Theories
items.text: Combining biological, psychological, and sociological perspectives to comprehensively explain criminal psychology.

data.title: Formation of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter explores the impact of individual factors, environmental factors, and psychological processes on the formation of criminal psychology.

items.title: Genetic Factors
items.text: Studying the potential links between genes and criminal behavior.

items.title: Psychological Traits
items.text: Exploring the relationship between personality traits such as aggression, impulsivity, and criminality.

items.title: Personality Disorders
items.text: Analyzing the driving effects of psychological disorders like antisocial personality disorder on criminal behavior.

items.title: Early Experiences
items.text: Studying the long-term impacts of childhood trauma, domestic violence, and other factors on criminal psychology.

items.title: Family Environment
items.text: Exploring the shaping role of family structure and educational methods on criminal psychology.

items.title: Social Environmental Influences
items.text: Analyzing the inducement effects of peer pressure and community environment on criminal behavior.

items.title: Economic Factors
items.text: Studying the relationship between economic issues like poverty, unemployment, and crime rates.

items.title: Cultural Background
items.text: Exploring the impact of cultural values on criminal psychology.

items.title: Cognitive Processes
items.text: Analyzing the thinking patterns, decision-making models, and their impacts on the behavior of criminals.

items.title: Emotional Processes
items.text: Exploring the relationship between emotional regulation, emotional deficits, and criminal behavior.

items.title: Behavioral Motivations
items.text: Studying the internal motivations of criminals, such as profit-driven and revengeful psychologies.

items.title: Decision-making Mechanisms
items.text: Analyzing the decision-making processes and psychological mechanisms of criminals before committing a crime.

data.title: Types of Crime and Psychological Characteristics
data.text: This chapter analyzes the psychological characteristics of violent crimes, property crimes, and cybercrimes.

items.title: Murder Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the psychological motivations of murderers, such as emotional conflicts and disputes over interests.

items.title: Robbery Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the risk-taking psychology and dependence on violence of robbers.

items.title: Sexual Crime Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Studying the psychological distortions and behavioral patterns of sexual offenders.

items.title: Domestic Violence Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the controlling desires and emotional deficiencies of domestic violence perpetrators.

items.title: Theft Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the opportunistic psychology and material desires of thieves.

items.title: Fraud Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the deception skills and psychological manipulation abilities of fraudsters.

items.title: Embezzlement Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Studying the power desires and moral corruption of embezzlers.

items.title: Money Laundering Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the risk avoidance psychology and legal evasion strategies of money launderers.

items.title: Hacker Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Exploring the technological worship and authority-challenging psychologies of hackers.

items.title: Online Fraud Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Analyzing the disguise abilities and psychological manipulation skills of online fraudsters.

items.title: Cyber Violence Psychological Characteristics
items.text: Studying the anonymous psychology and aggressiveness of cyber violence perpetrators.

items.title: Internet Addiction and Crime
items.text: Exploring the dependence of internet addicts on the virtual world and its correlation with criminal behavior.

data.title: Evaluation and Intervention of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter introduces the methods of evaluating criminal psychology and intervention strategies, and discusses preventive measures.

items.title: Psychological Testing
items.text: Assessing the psychological state and personality traits of criminals through standardized tests.

items.title: Behavioral Observation
items.text: Observing the daily behaviors of criminals to analyze their behavioral patterns and psychological motivations.

items.title: Interview Techniques
items.text: Understanding the psychological journey and criminal motivations of criminals through in-depth interviews.

items.title: Case Analysis
items.text: Analyzing the psychological characteristics and behavioral patterns of criminals through typical cases.

items.title: Psychotherapy
items.text: Helping criminals correct psychological problems through psychological counseling and therapy.

items.title: Behavioral Correction
items.text: Helping criminals change undesirable behavior patterns through behavioral training.

items.title: Social Support
items.text: Providing social resource support to help criminals reintegrate into society.

items.title: Legal Intervention
items.text: Restraining and punishing criminal behavior through legal means.

items.title: Early Intervention
items.text: Preventing potential criminals' behavioral problems through early psychological intervention.

items.title: Educational Prevention
items.text: Enhancing the public's legal awareness and psychological health level through education.

items.title: Community Prevention
items.text: Reducing crime incentives through community activities to enhance social cohesion.

items.title: Policy Prevention
items.text: Reducing social inequality and lowering crime rates through policy formulation.

data.title: Applications of Criminal Psychology
data.text: This chapter explores the applications of criminal psychology in criminal justice, crime prevention, and research education.

items.title: Criminal Psychological Profiling
items.text: Assisting in case solving through psychological analysis to depict the characteristics of criminals.

items.title: Interrogation Techniques
items.text: Improving interrogation efficiency and obtaining truthful confessions using psychological methods.

items.title: Witness Psychology
items.text: Studying the psychological state of witnesses and its impact on the credibility of testimonies.

items.title: Jury Decision-making
items.text: Analyzing the psychological processes of jurors and their impact on verdicts.

items.title: Crime Prevention Strategies
items.text: Preventing criminal behavior through psychological intervention and social support.

items.title: Prison Psychological Correction
items.text: Helping inmates correct psychological problems and reduce recidivism through psychological therapy.

items.title: Community Correction
items.text: Helping criminals reintegrate into society and reduce recidivism risks through community support.

items.title: Recidivism Prevention
items.text: Reducing the likelihood of reoffending through psychological assessment and intervention.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Research
items.text: Deepening the understanding of criminal psychology through scientific research and promoting the development of the discipline.

items.title: Criminal Psychology Education
items.text: Cultivating professionals and enhancing the application level of criminal psychology through education.

items.title: Professional Training
items.text: Enhancing the psychological knowledge and skills of judicial personnel through training.

items.title: Academic Exchange
items.text: Promoting international cooperation and development in the field of criminal psychology through academic exchanges.

data.title: Future Development Trends
data.text: This chapter explores the future development directions of criminal psychology in terms of technological applications, interdisciplinary cooperation, and ethical challenges.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence and Criminal Psychology
items.text: Using artificial intelligence technology to analyze criminal data and improve crime prediction capabilities.

items.title: Big Data Analysis
items.text: Mining the patterns and psychological characteristics of criminal behavior through big data technology.

items.title: Virtual Reality Technology
items.text: Using virtual reality technology to simulate crime scenes and study the psychological reactions of criminals.

items.title: Neuroscience Research
items.text: Exploring the biological basis of criminal behavior through neuroscience research.

items.title: Psychology and Law
items.text: Strengthening the cooperation between psychology and law to enhance the scientific nature of the judicial system.

items.title: Psychology and Medicine
items.text: Deepening the understanding of criminal psychology through the combination of psychology and medicine.

items.title: Psychology and Sociology
items.text: Comprehensively analyzing criminal phenomena through interdisciplinary research between psychology and sociology.

items.title: Psychology and Information Technology
items.text: Developing new tools for crime prevention and intervention by integrating psychology with information technology.

items.title: Ethical Issues
items.text: Exploring the ethical dilemmas in criminal psychology research and solutions.

items.title: Privacy Protection
items.text: Studying how to protect personal privacy in the application of criminal psychology.

items.title: Data Security
items.text: Analyzing the security risks of criminal psychology data and protective measures.

items.title: Future Challenges
items.text: Exploring the technological and social challenges that criminal psychology may face in future development.
